Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Hi PCN, ...In the meantime, can you give us your biopsy report details, along with your post-op pathology report and your age? This will give us a better idea of what you might be dealing with. Good luck, Chuck Pictures of my pathology report below. I believe you can click on the magnifying glass to zoom in: http://i132.photobucket.com/albums/q...pszu6hh37z.jpg http://i132.photobucket.com/albums/q...psxqgcfus0.jpg I guess this forum doesn't allow embedded pictures.
Posts.Title: Radical 4 years ago- PSA low but rising...

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH ... It IS possible that the surgeon may have left some benign prostate tissue behind -- which would continue to produce PSA at low levels. Hopefully this is the answer, which would mean there is actually no recurrence taking place. I hope that is the answer. Chuck I wonder if there is a way too tell. I'm thinking I'd prefer to go the radiation route over hormone therapy. Need to duo more research.

Posts.Title: Radical 4 years ago- PSA low but rising...

Posts.Content: Just curious if anyone else has had this situation, and what you found. I had my prostate removed in Oct 2011. PSA for 2 years was what they consider 0. Last year it was .14, and this year it is .23 I'm seeing a different doctor from who removed it. They are sending to get the follow-up lab results. Commented he may put me on hormones...which I don't look forward to. I was thinking these numbers were so low, not a big deal. But he said as it is rising, it indicates there must be some remaining cancer. Interested in thoughts on this.
Posts.Title: Radical 4 years ago- PSA low but rising...

Posts.Content: Marty...do you get same type of pain, but much less, with Edex? I find I get an ache, but it's quite tolerable. But the results aren't good enough for me, so I'll need to be looking for something else.
Posts.Title: Edex not working so well...

Posts.Content: The erections I'm getting when using Edex are not sufficient. A bit hard to describe, but instead of a good strong erection, it seems like there is something inside the penus that is hard, as opposed to a solid penis. Cannot effect a penetration. Have any of you started with Edex, and moved on to something that works better?
Posts.Title: Edex not working so well...

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by MartyAtx Yes, less pain with Edex but the results aren't good enough. I was getting great erections with the Trimix, but was too painful for me. Marty I'm curious what you are doing now then. Edex not good enough, Trimix too painful. FYI...i've been doing a lot of reading, and I've read several times that when the pain is too much (not from needle, but from Trimix), it is often a sign of too high a dose. What does your Dr. think about it? Also, some reading I've done has indicated many are getting better results if using a C Ring too. Although, I'm a bit confused as to when you put that on. I have ordered a couple different ones to try.
Posts.Title: Edex not working so well...

Posts.Content: Should I expect PSA reading to increase, even if just a little? My surgery was last October. I was gleason 6. Surgery type was DaVinci, nerves spared. In Jan PSA was .01; Apr was .01; Just got another and it is .02. I am presuming that is still not of concern, but just curious if others are seeing no increase at all. I will be seeing my Dr. later this month. But curious what folks are seeing.
Posts.Title: 9 Months since surgery-> PSA up a bit
